page.title: 07STOCKPORT STATION
page.content: The Railway Station is situated on Station Road, off Wellington Road, close to the Town Centre. It was opened in 1843 and originally had two lines. Later two more lines were added, so today there are four tracks with four platforms and two work bays. The lines were modernised in December 1971. The station handles some 15,000 passengers a day with an average of 14 trains an hour - 350 passenger trains a day. The{Inter-City}trains go mainly to{London (Euston)}and the{West {Country.}Local commuter trains go to Alderley Edge, Altrincham, Buxton, Macclesfield, Manchester, Stalybridge and Wilmslow. The station employs 70 people.
